events.title: The Blitz: Bombing of Coventry
events.description: During World War II, the German Luftwaffe launched a devastating bombing raid on the English city of Coventry, causing widespread destruction and civilian casualties.
events.significance: The raid highlighted the intensity of German air attacks on Britain and galvanized British resolve during the war.

events.title: The Supreme Court Rules on Browder v. Gayle
events.description: The U.S. Supreme Court upheld a lower court ruling that declared segregation on Alabama buses unconstitutional, effectively ending the Montgomery Bus Boycott.
events.significance: This ruling was a crucial legal victory in the Civil Rights Movement, advancing the cause of desegregation in the United States.

events.title: Margaret Thatcher Resigns as UK Prime Minister
events.description: After more than a decade in office, Margaret Thatcher resigned as leader of the Conservative Party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.
events.significance: Thatcher's resignation marked the end of an era in British politics characterized by conservative economic policies and leadership style known as Thatcherism.

events.title: Cyclone Sidr Hits Bangladesh
events.description: Cyclone Sidr, a Category 5 tropical cyclone, struck Bangladesh resulting in thousands of deaths and widespread destruction.
events.significance: One of the deadliest cyclones in recent history, it emphasized the vulnerability of coastal regions to extreme weather and the importance of disaster preparedness.
